intro: Mouriri morleyi, commonly known as the Morley's mouriri, is a small evergreen shrub native to the rainforests of northern Queensland, Australia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy dark green leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by orange-red berries that are edible for certain bird species. Mouriri morleyi is typically found in moist, shaded understorey environments and is adapted to the humid tropical climate. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local ecosystem and a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
